item.title: My Beautiful Camera
item.description:
My Beautiful Camera

After a good bit of use and falling in love with it, I am selling my Nikon D750. I don't want to, but I have to. My ultimate long term goal is to either a) buy another one or b) pick up a Sony A7II. I think the Sony will be better for my needs. It's smaller and lighter, ideal for running around the park or casual walks out ‚Äî which is all the D750 was used for. If I were ever to "go pro" in the future, I would definitely jump back to a fully DSLR, but then I would have to consider Canon, especially if I went into weddings/portraits.

item.title: A Smile On My Face
item.description:
A Smile On My Face

Nothing puts a smile on your face like a bike. Picked up a shining example of a CBR600RR today from The Super Bike Factory. Highly recommend them and all their bikes look pretty mint.¬†

item.title: City Smiles
item.description:
City Smiles

I love this one. A long journey home all for the sake of going on a double-decker bus, but bokehlicious lights on the backdrop of Liverpool.

item.title: iOS 9.3 & Night Shift
item.description:
iOS 9.3 & Night Shift

Now, I don't think 'steal' is the correct word here. Historically, Apple has lifted ideas from the jailbreak community ‚Äî where f.lux made it's rise to fame ‚Äî and implemented them natively into iOS. From notification centre, control centre and quick reply and now f.lux. Heck, even folders for iOS apps was originally a jailbreak tweak; I think with the community innovating, iOS would have stagnated a long time ago.

item.title: Philips Hue Bulbs & Why I Can't Afford To Be A Geek
item.description:
Philips Hue Bulbs & Why I Can't Afford To Be A Geek

I‚Äôve wanted some smart bulbs for a long time. Something about the ‚Äúyou don‚Äôt have to get of your ass to turn the lights off‚Äù scenario really appeals to my lazy side AND my inner geek.

item.title: My 3-months-late, first impressions of the new Apple TV
item.description:
My 3-months-late, first impressions of the new Apple TV

‚ÄòThe New Apple TV‚Äô ‚Äî it‚Äôs unofficial, official name since Apple doesn‚Äôt actually assign it a number unlike the iPhone, iPad and iPod line1 ‚Äî has been around now for about 3 months. There are plenty of reviews on the web. From Cult of Mac to RedmondPie, opinions are plentiful. I didn‚Äôt read a single review before buying mine. I didn‚Äôt really need to, because I knew all I needed to know: there is a Plex app and there is a VLC app.
